clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Guselkumab in Participants With Moderately to Severely Active Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2b/3, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, Multicenter Protocol to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Guselkumab in Participants With Moderately to Severely Active Ulcerative Colitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of guselkumab in participants with moderately to severely active ulcerative colitis (UC).

detailed_description.textblock: UC is a chronic disease of the large intestine, in which the lining of the colon becomes inflamed and develops ulcers. Guselkumab is a fully human immunoglobulin G1 lambda monoclonal antibody (mAb) that binds to human interleukin (IL)-23 with high affinity. The study is designed to answer scientific questions pertaining to the efficacy and safety of guselkumab in the treatment of moderately to severely active UC. Overall, the study will evaluate long-term guselkumab treatment. Efficacy, safety, pharmacokinetics (PK), immunogenicity, and biomarkers will be assessed at specified time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Induction Study 1: Clinical Response at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Clinical response per modified Mayo score.

primary_outcome.measure: Induction Study 2: Clinical Remission at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Clinical remission per modified Mayo score.

primary_outcome.measure: Maintenance Study: Clinical Remission at Week 44
primary_outcome.description: Clinical remission per modified Mayo score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Induction Study 1: Clinical Remission at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission per modified Mayo score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Induction Study 1: Symptomatic Remission at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Symptomatic remission per stool frequency and rectal bleeding subscores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Induction Study 1: Endoscopic Healing at Week 12
Induction Study 1: Histo-Endoscopic Mucosal Healing at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Histo-endoscopic mucosal healing per endoscopy subscore and histologic grading.

Induction Study 2: Symptomatic Remission at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Symptomatic remission per stool frequency and rectal bleeding subscores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Induction Study 2: Endoscopic Healing at Week 12
Induction Study 2: Clinical Response at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response per modified Mayo score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Induction Study 2: Histo-Endoscopic Mucosal Healing at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Histo-endoscopic mucosal healing per endoscopy subscore and histologic grading.

secondary_outcome.description: Symptomatic remission per stool frequency and rectal bleeding subscores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Induction Study 2: Symptomatic Remission at Week 2
secondary_outcome.description: Symptomatic remission per stool frequency and rectal bleeding subscores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Induction Study 2: Endoscopic Normalization at Week 12
Maintenance Study: Symptomatic Remission at Week 44
secondary_outcome.description: Symptomatic remission per stool frequency and rectal bleeding subscores.

Maintenance Study: Corticosteroid-free Clinical Remission at Week 44
secondary_outcome.description: Corticosteroid-free clinical remission per modified Mayo score.

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response per modified Mayo score.

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission per modified Mayo score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maintenance Study: Endoscopic Normalization at Week 44

arm_group.description: Participants will receive guselkumab dose 1 intravenously (IV) in Induction Study 1. Subsequent study treatment will be determined by the participant's clinical response status at Week 12.
Participants will receive guselkumab dose 2 IV in Induction Study 1. Subsequent study treatment will be determined by the participant's clinical response status at Week 12.

Participants will receive matching placebo IV in Induction Study 1. Subsequent study treatment will be determined by the participant's clinical response status at Week 12. Clinical nonresponders will be administered guselkumab IV.
Participants will receive guselkumab IV in Induction Study 2. Subsequent study treatment will be determined by the participant's clinical response status at Week 12.

Participants will receive matching placebo IV in Induction Study 2. Subsequent study treatment will be determined by the participant's clinical response status at Week 12. Clinical nonresponders will be administered guselkumab IV.
Participants will receive guselkumab maintenance dose regimen 1 subcutaneously (SC) every 4 weeks (q4w).
Participants will receive guselkumab maintenance dose regimen 2 SC every 8 weeks (q8w).
Participants will receive matching placebo SC q4w.

intervention.description: Participants will receive matching placebo IV or SC.
Participants will receive guselkumab IV or SC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Documented diagnosis of ulcerative colitis (UC)
- Moderately to severely active UC, defined by modified Mayo score
- Demonstrated inadequate response or intolerance to medical therapies specified in the protocol
- Screening laboratory test results within the parameters specified in the protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of indeterminate colitis, microscopic colitis, ischemic colitis, or Crohn's disease or clinical findings suggestive of Crohn's disease
- UC limited to the rectum only or to less than (<) 20 centimeter (cm) of the colon
- Presence of a stoma
- Presence or history of a fistula
- Receiving prohibited medications and/or treatment

patient_data.ipd_description: The data sharing policy of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson is available at www.janssen.com/clinical-trials/transparency. As noted on this site, requests for access to the study data can be submitted through Yale Open Data Access (YODA) Project site at yoda.yale.edu
